en: You can't imagine how happy she was.
zh: 你无法想象她当时有多开心。

en: I did not notice how glad she was.
zh: 我没注意到她当时有多高兴。

en: However hard she tried, she was unable to please him.
zh: 不管她怎么努力，都没法让他满意。

en: No matter how hard she tried, she couldn't please him.
zh: 无论她怎么努力，都没法讨他欢心。

en: I feel a strong affinity for her.
zh: 我觉得跟她特别投缘。

en: To her great disappointment, it rained on the day of the picnic.
zh: 让她特别失望的是，野餐那天竟然下雨了。

en: Since she was wearing the very strange hat, people teased her.
zh: 因为她戴了个特别奇怪的帽子，大家都笑话她。

en: It happened that he appeared when she couldn't decide which way to go.
zh: 正当她不知道该往哪儿走的时候，他碰巧出现了。

en: Wherever she goes, her child follows her.
zh: 不管她去哪儿，孩子都跟着她。

en: It beats me where she's gone.
zh: 我真搞不懂她跑哪儿去了。

en: Do you happen to know where she lives?
zh: 你碰巧知道她住哪儿吗？

en: Do you know where she lives?
zh: 你知道她住哪儿吗？

en: Tell me where she lives.
zh: 告诉我她住哪儿。

en: Do you know where she is?
zh: 你知道她在哪儿吗？

en: No one could tell where she was.
zh: 谁也说不清她在哪里。

en: I know where she is.
zh: 我知道她在哪儿。

en: Do you know where he was born?
zh: 你知道他是在哪儿出生的吗？

en: I didn't know the reason why she began to cry.
zh: 我不知道她为什么哭了起来。

en: No sooner had she opened the door than a cat ran out.
zh: 她刚一开门，就有一只猫跑了出来。

en: As soon as she opened the door, a cat ran out.
zh: 她一开门，一只猫就跑了出来。

en: She had hardly opened the door when a white dog rushed out of the house.
zh: 她刚打开门，就有一只白狗从屋里冲了出来。

en: As soon as she opened the door, a white dog ran out of the house.
zh: 她一开门，一只白狗就从屋里跑了出来。

en: I feel badly that she failed her test.
zh: 她考试没及格，我心里挺难受的。

en: She will clear the table of the dishes.
zh: 她会把桌上的碗筷收拾了。

en: She was just about to take a bath when the bell rang.
zh: 她正准备洗澡，门铃就响了。

en: Do you know who she is?
zh: 你知道她是谁吗？

en: I wish that she would stop smoking.
zh: 我真希望她能把烟给戒了。

en: She can't have said such a thing.
zh: 她不可能说出这种话。

en: It is strange that she should say such a thing.
zh: 她居然会说那种话，真是奇怪。

en: It is careless of her to make such a mistake.
zh: 她犯这种错误也太粗心了。

en: I am surprised that she refused such a good offer.
zh: 我很惊讶她居然拒绝了这么好的机会。

en: It is strange that she should go home so early.
zh: 真奇怪，她居然这么早就回家了。

en: I can't bear that she should suffer so.
zh: 我看不得她受这种罪。

en: Don't you think it odd that she was in such a hurry?
zh: 你不觉得她走得那么急很奇怪吗？

en: She cannot have said that.
zh: 她不可能说过那种话。

en: It is surprising that she should say so.
zh: 她居然会这么说，真让人意外。

en: She cannot have done such a thing.
zh: 她不可能干出那种事。

en: It is curious that she should have asked you such a thing.
zh: 奇怪的是，她居然会问你这种事。

en: It is strange that she should do such a thing.
zh: 她竟然会做这种事，真奇怪。

en: The time will come when she will repent of it.
zh: 总有一天她会后悔的。

en: The time will come when she'll regret it.
zh: 总有一天她会后悔的。

en: She cannot have done it.
zh: 那事儿不可能是她干的。

en: You can't deny the fact that she had a hand in it.
zh: 你没法否认这件事跟她有关。

en: It's surprising that she doesn't know anything about it.
zh: 她居然对此一无所知，真让人意外。

en: She had hardly begun to read the book before someone knocked at the door.
zh: 她刚开始看书，就有人敲门了。

en: She'd just begun to read the book when someone knocked on the door.
zh: 她刚打开书看，就有人敲门了。

en: It beats me how she could have gotten that secret information.
zh: 我真搞不懂她是怎么弄到那个秘密消息的。

en: Her implication in the crime was obvious.
zh: 显然她也牵连进这桩罪案里了。

en: She bought a book at the shop.
zh: 她在店里买了一本书。

en: It will take her at least two years to be qualified for that post.
zh: 她至少得花两年时间才能胜任那个职位。

en: No one doubts her fitness for the post.
zh: 没人怀疑她胜任这份工作的能力。

en: She may well be beside herself with joy at the news.
zh: 听到这个消息，她很可能会欣喜若狂。

en: She may have been surprised when she heard the news.
zh: 她听到这消息时可能吓了一跳。

en: Seeing that she was not excited at the news, she must have known it.
zh: 看她听到消息一点也不激动，肯定早就知道了。

en: I thought it difficult for her to get the ticket.
zh: 我原以为她很难弄到票。

en: I thought it would be difficult for her to get the tickets.
zh: 我当时觉得她拿这些票会挺难的。

en: The baby had been crying for an hour when she found it.
zh: 她发现孩子的时候，孩子已经哭了一个多小时了。

en: She may well be pleased with the success.
zh: 她很有可能对这次成功挺满意的。

en: It is no wonder that she was given the prize.
zh: 难怪她能得奖。

en: Great was her surprise when she knew the fact.
zh: 她知道真相后吃惊坏了。

en: She looked after the child.
zh: 她照顾过那个孩子。

en: Nobody knows what has become of her.
zh: 谁都不知道她后来怎么样了。

en: It took a whole day to paint the picture.
zh: 画这幅画花了一整天。

en: I often heard her sing that song.
zh: 我经常听她唱那首歌。

en: She can not have said such a thing.
zh: 她不可能说过这种话。

en: She can't have done such a thing.
zh: 她不可能做出这种事。

en: She reported the news.
zh: 她报道了那则新闻。

en: Can you make it so she can get on that TV program?
zh: 你能想办法让她上那个电视节目吗？

en: By the time she gets there, it will be nearly dark.
zh: 等她到那儿的时候，天估计都快黑了。

en: That she was there is certain.
zh: 她当时肯定在那儿。

en: It was a camera that she bought there.
zh: 她在那儿买的是个相机。

en: What she bought there was a camera.
zh: 她在那儿买的东西是个相机。

en: She came out of there.
zh: 她从那里面出来了。

en: She can't have said so.
zh: 她不可能那样说过。

en: She may well say so.
zh: 她很有可能会这么说。

en: It was surprising that she said that.
zh: 她居然会那样说，真让人吃惊。

en: It is quite strange that she should say so.
zh: 她居然会这样说，真是太奇怪了。

en: It was quite right of her to do that.
zh: 她那样做挺对的。

en: I hope that she'll get well soon.
zh: 希望她能早点好起来。

en: There is little hope of her getting well soon.
zh: 她估计很难很快好起来。

en: We hope she will take heart soon.
zh: 我们希望她能快点振作起来。

en: She will soon clear away these dishes.
zh: 她马上就会把这些盘子收走。

en: Everybody knew that she was being pushy.
zh: 大家都知道她那时候挺强势的。

en: She married John, not because she loved him, but because he was a rich man.
zh: 她嫁给约翰不是因为爱他，而是因为他是个有钱人。

en: I never saw him in jeans.
zh: 我以前从没见他穿过牛仔裤。

en: I've never seen him in jeans.
zh: 我从来没见过他穿牛仔裤。

en: I've never seen him wearing jeans.
zh: 我从没见过他穿牛仔裤的样子。

en: That she behaves this way is odd.
zh: 她表现成这样挺奇怪的。

en: She cannot be here so early.
zh: 她不可能这么早就到。

en: Never was she so frightened.
zh: 她从来没被吓得这么厉害过。

en: She'd never been this frightened before.
zh: 她以前从来没这么害怕过。

en: She'd never been so frightened.
zh: 她以前从没被吓成这样。

en: Her mother has made her what she is.
zh: 是她母亲把她培养成了现在的样子。

en: It is deplorable that she is so selfish.
zh: 她这人这么自私，真让人无语。

en: She will show you around this town.
zh: 她会带你在这镇上转转。

en: I saw her coming up the road.
zh: 我看到她顺着路走过来了。

en: A year has passed since she came here.
zh: 她来这儿已经一年了。

en: It doesn't matter to me whether she comes here or not.
zh: 她来不来这儿，对我来说都无所谓。

en: If only she were here, she would tell me what to do.
zh: 要是她在这儿就好了，她会告诉我该怎么办。

en: I'm sorry she's not here.
zh: 很可惜她不在这儿。

en: Let's suppose that she is here.
zh: 咱们假设她就在这儿吧。

en: It's exciting to watch her run after a cockroach.
zh: 看她追蟑螂还挺好玩的。

en: Did you know she is good at making coffee?
zh: 你知道她煮咖啡很厉害吗？

en: He had been reading for two hours when she came in.
zh: 她进来的时候，他已经看了两个小时书了。

en: I heard that she came here.
zh: 我听说她来这儿了。

en: She played the guitar and he sang.
zh: 她弹吉他，他唱歌。

en: When she lit the gas, there was a loud explosion.
zh: 她一点火，煤气就“砰”地一声爆炸了。

en: It is not rare that she leaves her umbrella behind.
zh: 她忘带雨伞是常有的事。

en: You must be careful that she doesn't fall over the cliff.
zh: 你得小心点，别让她掉下悬崖。

en: Hardly had she got in the bath when the postman knocked on the door with a parcel.
zh: 她刚进澡盆，邮递员就带着包裹来敲门了。

en: Scarcely had she put on her makeup before he arrived.
zh: 她刚化好妆，他就到了。

en: She was a sight when she didn't wear makeup.
zh: 她不化妆的样子简直没法看。

en: Why don't you just call a spade a spade and admit that she dumped you for that American guy she met at the English school?
zh: 你干嘛不干脆实话实说，承认她是为了她在英语学校认识的那个美国男的才把你甩了？

en: She may well feel unhappy.
zh: 她很可能觉得不开心。

en: I was angry that she had deceived my children.
zh: 我很生气，她居然骗了我的孩子。

en: She cannot have told a lie.
zh: 她不可能撒谎的。

en: It became clear that she'd told a lie.
zh: 显然她撒谎了。

en: He will be angry to learn that she told a lie.
zh: 他要是知道她撒谎了，肯定会生气的。

en: It's not as though the world is going to end if she leaves.
zh: 就算她走了，天也不会塌下来。

en: I miss her so much.
zh: 我太想她了。

en: It's anybody's guess when she'll come.
zh: 谁也说不准她什么时候来。

en: Do you know when she will come?
zh: 你知道她什么时候来吗？

en: Whenever she may come, I am ready to welcome her.
zh: 不管她什么时候来，我都会欢迎她。

en: Who cares when she will marry?
zh: 谁管她什么时候打算结婚啊？

en: Who cares when she gets married?
zh: 谁在乎她什么时候结婚？

en: I don't know when she will leave for London.
zh: 我不知道她什么时候动身去伦敦。

en: It is not clear when and where she was born.
zh: 还不清楚她在什么时候、什么地方出生的。

en: I really don't understand what's up with her.
zh: 我真搞不懂她到底是怎么了。

en: Try as she may, she is unable to beat him.
zh: 尽管她很努力，还是赢不了他。

en: It is surprising how little she knows of the world.
zh: 没想到她对这个世界这么不了解。

en: She gave me some good advice.
zh: 她给了我一些很好的建议。

en: She spoke too quickly, so I couldn't understand.
zh: 她说得太快了，我没听懂。

en: It's strange that she should have come home so late at night.
zh: 她居然大半夜才回家，真是太奇怪了。

en: It's strange that she came home so late at night.
zh: 奇怪，她晚上居然回得这么晚。

en: Do you know the reason why she is so angry?
zh: 你知道她为什么发这么大火吗？

en: Do you know why she's so angry?
zh: 你知道她为什么这么生气吗？

en: I am surprised that she should have changed so much.
zh: 没想到她变了这么多。

en: I heard her speaking English as fluently as a citizen of the USA.
zh: 我听她说英语说得跟美国人一样流利。

en: I heard her speaking English as fluently as an American.
zh: 我听她说英语说得跟美国人一样地道。

en: I heard her speaking English fluently, like an American.
zh: 我听她说英语说得很流利，就像美国人似的。

en: I took her for an American.
zh: 我把她当成美国人了。

en: That she grew up in America is well-known.
zh: 大家都知道她是在美国长大的。

en: Why is it that she was at the mercy of that friend of hers?
zh: 为什么她要被那个朋友牵着鼻子走呢？

en: It was clear that she was not concerned with the matter.
zh: 很明显，她并不关心这件事。

en: In that pink dress, she was it.
zh: 她穿那条粉色裙子，简直绝了。

en: There is no reason for her to scold you.
zh: 她没理由骂你。

en: Is she your teacher?
zh: 她是你的老师吗？

en: She may well refuse to speak to you because she's in a very bad mood.
zh: 她心情可能很差，也许根本不想理你。

en: She cannot be over thirty.
zh: 她肯定不到三十岁。

en: See if you can catch the word she uses as she describes how she begins her day.
zh: 听听看，她在描述自己怎么开始一天的生活时用了哪个词。

en: I was astounded that she can speak 10 languages.
zh: 她竟然能说10种语言，真是惊到我了。

en: The reason she killed herself is unknown.
zh: 她自杀的原因还不清楚。

en: There's no way she'll ever marry Sato.
zh: 她绝不可能嫁给佐藤。

en: Can she get the law degree?
zh: 她能拿到法学学位吗？

en: She gets lost really easily. She's got no sense of direction.
zh: 她特别容易迷路，一点方向感都没有。

en: She is beautiful and how!
zh: 她长得那叫一个漂亮！

en: Her dress has an understated charm.
zh: 她的裙子有种低调的美感。

en: She seems down lately.
zh: 她最近看起来心情不太好。

en: She looks as if nothing had happened to her.
zh: 她看起来跟没事人一样。

en: What's wrong with her? She's looking kind of blue.
zh: 她怎么了？看着有点垂头丧气的。

en: She was taken in by his manners.
zh: 她被他温文尔雅的样子给骗了。

en: He himself did it.
zh: 这事是他亲手干的。

en: He himself went there.
zh: 他亲自去了那儿。

en: He himself said so.
zh: 他自己就是这么说的。

en: He lost his beloved son.
zh: 他失去了心爱的儿子。

en: His powerful speech carried the audience with him.
zh: 他那极具感染力的演讲打动了全场观众。

en: He has spent most of his working life as a diplomat.
zh: 他职业生涯的大部分时间都在当外交官。

en: He's an odd man; so we'll have him referee.
zh: 他这人挺古怪的，所以我们就让他当裁判。

en: He is nothing but a poet.
zh: 他只不过是个诗人。

en: All but for he are here.
zh: 除了他，大家都在。

en: Everyone is here except for him.
zh: 除了他以外，大家都在这儿。

en: Everybody except him thanked the critic for her honest opinion.
zh: 除了他，大家都感谢了那位评论家坦诚的意见。

en: Who should write it but himself?
zh: 除了他自己，还能有谁来写呢？

en: It is very difficult to make him out.
zh: 很难看透他这人。

en: It's very difficult to understand him.
zh: 很难理解他。

en: It is up to you to support him.
zh: 支持他就全靠你了。

en: Nobody ever praises him.
zh: 从来没人夸过他。

en: You should seclude him from temptation.
zh: 你应该让他远离诱惑。

en: There wasn't enough evidence to convict him of the crime.
zh: 证据不足，没法给他定罪。

en: He reported fully what he had seen to the police.
zh: 他把他看到的情况如实向警察报告了。

en: Don't arouse him from his sleep!
zh: 别把他吵醒了！

en: It's hard to please him.
zh: 他这人很难伺候。

en: I expected that I would visit him, but I couldn't.
zh: 我本来打算去看他的，但没去成。

en: I was welcomed whenever I visited him.
zh: 每次我去拜访他，他都很欢迎。

en: When I called on him, he was not at home.
zh: 我去找他的时候，他不在家。

en: I couldn't bring myself to call on him.
zh: 我实在没法说服自己去找他。

en: When I called on him, he was hard at work.
zh: 我去找他的时候，他正忙着干活。

en: I can't let him alone.
zh: 我没法不管他。

en: They buried him in his grave.
zh: 他们把他给埋了。

en: I doubt if he is a lawyer.
zh: 我怀疑他到底是不是律师。

en: I spoke to him kindly so as not to frighten him.
zh: 我温和地跟他说话，免得吓着他。

en: Could I ask you to drive him to the hospital?
zh: 能请你开车送他去医院吗？

en: I'll take him with me to the hospital.
zh: 我会带他一起去医院。

en: I must hasten to add that I do not mean to blame him.
zh: 我得赶紧补充一句，我并不是要怪他。

en: I cannot find fault with him.
zh: 我挑不出他什么毛病。

en: It is inevitable even if he is criticized.
zh: 就算他被批评也是难免的。

en: I am far from blaming him.
zh: 我压根儿就没想怪他。

en: His repeated delinquencies brought him to court.
zh: 他一再胡作非为，结果被告上了法庭。

en: It was wise of you to keep away from him.
zh: 你躲开他是明智的。

en: You ought to walk a mile in his shoes before you criticize him.
zh: 在你批评他之前，你应该先设身处地为他想想。

en: Few, if any, will criticize him.
zh: 几乎没人会批评他。

en: You can't mistake him for his younger brother.
zh: 你不可能把他和他弟弟搞混。

en: Don't call him the criminal.
zh: 别叫他罪犯。

en: Don't call him an idiot.
zh: 别骂他傻子。

en: Don't make a fool of him.
zh: 别耍他。

en: It is not his illness that ruined him so much as his idleness.
zh: 毁掉他的与其说是生病，不如说是懒散。

en: It was gambling that brought about his ruin.
zh: 是赌博害了他。

en: Nothing but a full apology would satisfy him.
zh: 除非正式道歉，否则他是不会满意的。

en: There are six people including him.
zh: 算上他一共六个人。

en: I gave no answer for fear I should confuse him.
zh: 我没回答，怕把他搞糊涂了。

en: You can rely upon him.
zh: 你可以信任他。

en: You must not shout at him.
zh: 你千万别对他大吼大叫。

en: I didn't say a word for fear I should annoy him.
zh: 我一句话也没说，怕惹他烦。

en: Try not to make him angry.
zh: 尽量别惹他生气。

en: I called him to the telephone.
zh: 我叫他来接电话。

en: Would you mind calling him to the phone?
zh: 麻烦叫他接个电话好吗？

en: It is no exaggeration to call him a genius.
zh: 说他是天才一点也不夸张。

en: Don't make an enemy of him.
zh: 别跟他结仇。

en: Through him I got acquainted with the big names of the town.
zh: 通过他，我认识了镇上的那些大人物。

en: I went after him, but I lost him in the crowd.
zh: 我去追他，但在人群里把他跟丢了。

en: Give him time.
zh: 给他点时间。

en: Bring him in.
zh: 把他带进来。

en: Let him in.
zh: 让他进来。

en: Put him in.
zh: 把他放进去。

en: Show him in.
zh: 带他进来。

en: The more I know him, the more I like him.
zh: 我越了解他就越喜欢他。

en: Not knowing him, I asked my sister about his job.
zh: 因为我不认识他，就问了我姐他是做什么的。

en: Who that knows him will believe it?
zh: 认识他的人谁会信呢？

en: Those who know him speak well of him.
zh: 认识他的人都说他好话。

en: All who knew him admired him.
zh: 认识他的人都很佩服他。

en: Everyone who knew him admired him.
zh: 每一个认识他的人都很钦佩他。

en: Do I know him?
zh: 我认识他吗？

en: Whether you know him or not, you have to support his opinion.
zh: 不管你认不认识他，你都得支持他的意见。

en: There is no possibility of our finding him.
zh: 我们不可能找到他了。

en: All we can do is to wait for him.
zh: 我们能做的只有等他。

en: All we can do is wait for him.
zh: 我们只能等他了。

en: There was nothing that I could do but wait for him.
zh: 除了等他，我什么也做不了。

en: I am inclined to wait for him and start.
zh: 我想等他到了再出发。

en: He is inclined to start at once, without waiting for him.
zh: 他想不等他就马上出发。

en: He is impossible to beat.
zh: 根本没人能打败他。

en: Some of his students admired him, and others despised him.
zh: 他的学生里有人崇拜他，也有人瞧不起他。

en: We have no trust in him.
zh: 我们一点都不信任他。

en: You're the only person that can persuade him.
zh: 只有你能说服他。

en: We found it impossible to persuade him.
zh: 我们发现根本没法说服他。

en: It is difficult, if not impossible, to persuade him.
zh: 就算不是不可能，也很难说服他。

en: It is absurd trying to persuade him.
zh: 想说服他简直是胡闹。

en: There's no use trying to persuade him.
zh: 试着劝他是没用的。

en: It is no use trying to persuade him.
zh: 劝他也是白费力气。

en: I had a hard time trying to talk him out of taking the trip.
zh: 我费了老大的劲才劝他别去旅行。

en: It was difficult to persuade him to cancel the trip.
zh: 很难说服他取消这次旅行。

en: It was hard to persuade him to cancel the trip.
zh: 好不容易才说服他取消旅行。

en: It was difficult to convince him to cancel the trip.
zh: 要让他取消旅行可真不容易。

en: I had a hard time trying to persuade him to cancel the trip.
zh: 为了劝他取消旅行，我费了好大的劲。

en: It took a long time to bring him around to our point of view.
zh: 费了好大劲才让他转变看法。

en: I wish I could have persuaded him to join us.
zh: 要是我当时能劝动他加入我们就好了。

en: I figure that there is no point in trying to persuade him.
zh: 我看去劝他也只是白费口舌。

en: I don't see any point in persuading him.
zh: 我看没必要劝他。

en: We couldn't get anywhere in our attempt to convince him.
zh: 我们怎么劝都没用。

en: I convinced him of his fault.
zh: 我让他认识到了自己的错误。

en: I tried to talk him out of the project, but in vain.
zh: 我劝他别搞那个项目，但没劝动。

en: In believing him to be an honest man, I was seriously in error.
zh: 我真是看走眼了，竟然觉得他是个老实人。

en: I erred in thinking him trustworthy.
zh: 我看错人了，居然觉得他靠谱。

en: I was mistaken in thinking that he was a trustworthy man.
zh: 我当初真不该觉得他值得信任。

en: Don't trust him.
zh: 别信他。

en: You are very silly to trust him.
zh: 你竟然信他，真傻。

en: You're stupid to trust him.
zh: 你太笨了，竟然会信他。

en: You should not trust him.
zh: 你不该信他。

en: You can trust him.
zh: 你可以相信他。

en: You can't trust him.
zh: 你不能信他。

en: You ought not to believe him.
zh: 你不该信他的话。

en: You should have known better than to trust him.
zh: 你早该知道他不可信。

en: I believe in him.
zh: 我相信他。

en: It is stupid of you to believe in him.
zh: 你相信他真是太傻了。

en: It was stupid of you to believe in him.
zh: 你当时竟然信他，真是太傻了。

en: Don't laugh at him.
zh: 别笑话他。

en: It makes him a laughingstock.
zh: 这让他成了大家的笑柄。

en: There was no one who did not admire him.
zh: 大家都挺佩服他的。

en: You ought to have invited him, but you didn't.
zh: 你本来应该请他的，但你没请。

en: You should have invited him, but you didn't.
zh: 你当时该邀请他的，可你没去。

en: I feel kind of sorry for him.
zh: 我觉得他挺可怜的。

en: Outside of him, no one else came to the party.
zh: 除了他，谁都没来参加派对。

en: With the exception of him, nobody else came to the party.
zh: 除了他，没别人来派对。

en: He was the only one who came to the party.
zh: 派对就他一个人来了。

en: Do you hold him in great account?
zh: 你很看重他吗？

en: He shall be fired.
zh: 他要被开除了。

en: We came to the conclusion that he should be fired.
zh: 我们觉得还是得开除他。

en: Follow his example.
zh: 向他学习。

en: We adopt him as our representative.
zh: 我们选他做我们的代表。

en: We thought it impossible to stop him.
zh: 我们觉得根本拦不住他。

en: I made believe that I supported him.
zh: 我假装支持他。

en: I pretended to support him.
zh: 我假装支持他的样子。

en: They acclaimed him their leader.
zh: 他们推举他当了首领。

en: You should be careful not to bother him.
zh: 你小心点，别去烦他。

en: What's the accusation against him?
zh: 他被指控了什么罪名？

en: Can any girl like him?
zh: 哪个女孩子会喜欢他啊？

en: I could hardly keep from liking him.
zh: 我真的没法不喜欢他。

en: Some people like him and other people don't.
zh: 有人喜欢他，也有人讨厌他。

en: It stands to reason that nobody likes him. He's too mean.
zh: 没人喜欢他是理所当然的，他这人太损了。

en: It's natural that no one likes him. He's really mean.
zh: 难怪没人喜欢他，他这人太刻薄了。

en: It's not that I seriously like him. I just find him very attractive.
zh: 我也不是真的有多喜欢他，只是觉得他挺有魅力的。

en: To do him justice, he is not stupid.
zh: 说句公道话，他不傻。

en: To do him justice, he is a nice guy.
zh: 说句公道话，他人挺好的。

en: If you treat him fairly, he will be fair with you.
zh: 你要是公平对他，他也会公平对你。

en: His age didn't enter into our decision not to employ him.
zh: 我们决定不雇他跟他的年龄没关系。

en: When you employ him, you must make allowances for his youth.
zh: 你要是雇他的话，得体谅他年纪还小。

en: Employing him would amount to employing nobody.
zh: 雇他就跟没雇人一样。

en: I inquired after him.
zh: 我问了问他的近况。

en: Keep watch on him.
zh: 盯着点他。

en: I have been to the station to see him off.
zh: 我刚去车站送他了。

en: I have been to the airport to see him off.
zh: 我刚去机场送他了。

en: I went to the airport to see him off.
zh: 我去机场送他了。

en: To look at him, you could hardly believe it.
zh: 看他的样子，你简直不敢相信。

en: The instant I saw him I knew he was angry.
zh: 我一见到他，就知道他生气了。

en: Able was I ere I saw him.
zh: 没见到他之前，我还挺有能耐的。

en: I cannot see him without thinking of my brother.
zh: 我一看到他，就会想起我哥。

en: He reminds me of my grandfather.
zh: 他让我想起我爷爷。

en: When I see him, I think of my grandfather.
zh: 每次见到他，我都会想起我爷爷。

en: The instant I saw him, I knew he was ill.
zh: 我一见到他，就知道他病了。

en: The moment I saw him, I knew he was angry.
zh: 我一看到他，就知道他生气了。

en: I never see him without thinking of my son.
zh: 我每次见到他都会想起我儿子。

en: I cannot help but sympathize with him any time I see him.
zh: 每次见到他，我总会忍不住同情他。

en: To look at him, you couldn't help laughing.
zh: 看到他那样子，你肯定会忍不住想笑。

en: Every time I looked at him, he was yawning.
zh: 我每次看他，他都在打哈欠。

en: Look at him. He's drunk again.
zh: 看他，又喝醉了。

en: I don't see him.
zh: 我没看见他。

en: As soon as I saw him, I burst into laughter.
zh: 我一见到他就忍不住大笑起来。

en: I could not help laughing when I saw him.
zh: 我见到他时忍不住笑了。

en: Go and meet him, and while you're about it mail this letter.
zh: 去接接他，顺便把这封信寄了。

en: You'd better not make light of him.
zh: 你最好别小看他。

en: We gave him a royal send-off at the airport.
zh: 我们在机场隆重地为他送了行。

en: I saw him off at the airport.
zh: 我去机场送他了。

en: You may call him a fool, but you cannot call him a coward.
zh: 你可以说他傻，但不能说他胆小。

en: It never occurred to me to doubt him.
zh: 我压根儿没想过要怀疑他。

en: We did not move for fear we should wake him up.
zh: 我们一动都不敢动，生怕吵醒他。

en: Let's receive him with a happy smile.
zh: 咱们笑着去迎接他吧。

en: I couldn't help feeling sorry for him.
zh: 我忍不住觉得他很可怜。

en: I can't pretend to like him.
zh: 我没法装作喜欢他。

en: He is hard to please.
zh: 他这人很难伺候。

en: It is difficult to make him happy.
zh: 很难让他高兴起来。

en: There is a good argument for dismissing him.
zh: 有充分的理由开除他。

en: We failed to bring him to agree to our plan.
zh: 我们没能让他同意我们的计划。

en: I managed to bring him around to my way of thinking.
zh: 我总算说服他接受了我的想法。

en: I don't blame you for hitting him.
zh: 你动手打他我不怪你。

en: It is incumbent on us to support him.
zh: 支持他是我们的责任。

en: I accommodated him with a night's lodging.
zh: 我收留他住了一晚。

en: Leave him alone.
zh: 别理他。

en: I don't pretend to love him.
zh: 我并不假装爱他。

en: Whoever knows him well respects him.
zh: 了解他的人都很尊敬他。

en: All the more so to think well of him.
zh: 这样更应该看重他了。

en: Keep a close eye on him.
zh: 盯紧他。

en: Watch him and do likewise.
zh: 看着他，照他那样做。

en: Watch him and do the same thing.
zh: 盯着他，照他的样子做。

en: Watch him and do what he does.
zh: 看他干什么，你也跟着干什么。

en: Cornering him in an argument is easy - like taking candy from a baby.
zh: 辩论时把他难住太容易了，简直是小菜一碟。

en: There was no one but admired him.
zh: 没人不佩服他。

en: I planned to introduce him to Beatrice.
zh: 我打算把他介绍给碧翠丝。

en: I went all the way to see him only to find him not at home.
zh: 我大老远跑去找他，结果他不在家。

en: I didn't invite him to the party. I feel guilty about it.
zh: 我聚会没请他，心里挺过意不去的。

en: Quiet him down, will you?
zh: 让他安静点，行吗？

en: We cannot praise him too much.
zh: 怎么夸他都不过分。

en: The Stars must be kicking themselves for giving him the boot.
zh: 明星队肯定在为把他踢走的事后悔呢。

en: Don't stop him.
zh: 别拦着他。

en: I feel like telling him what I think of him.
zh: 我真想告诉他我对他到底有什么看法。

en: What do you make of him?
zh: 你觉得他这人怎么样？

en: What do you think of him?
zh: 你对他怎么看？

en: I must help him.
zh: 我得帮帮他。

en: I caught a glimpse of him.
zh: 我刚才瞥见了他一眼。

en: Have him wait a moment.
zh: 让他等一下。

en: Don't take him in.
zh: 别蒙他。

en: Don't deceive him.
zh: 别骗他。

en: Don't cheat him.
zh: 别坑他。

en: Nobody knows what it is that has been bothering him so much.
zh: 谁也不知道到底是什么事让他这么心烦。

en: Dismiss him from that post.
zh: 撤了他的职吧。

en: I accommodated him for the night.
zh: 我留他住了一晚。

en: We have no call to appoint him to the post.
zh: 我们没理由非得委任他不可。

en: I regard him as the best person for the job.
zh: 我觉得他是这份工作的最佳人选。

en: Don't blame him for the error.
zh: 别因为这点错怪他。

en: He shan't go there.
zh: 他不准去那儿。

en: Let's call him Snoopy.
zh: 咱们叫他史努比吧。

en: He shall go at once.
zh: 他必须马上走。

en: It was decided that he should be sent for at once.
zh: 大家决定立刻派人去请他。

en: Please let him come at once.
zh: 请让他赶紧过来。

en: We decided to leave him alone for a while.
zh: 我们决定先让他一个人待会儿。

en: He shall be scolded.
zh: 他肯定得挨顿骂。

en: I'll scold him.
zh: 我会训他的。

en: There is no one that knows him who speaks ill of him.
zh: 认识他的人没一个不说他好话的。

en: Did you know him?
zh: 你以前认识他吗？

en: He shall not come into this house again.
zh: 他别想再进这个家门。

en: I can't help making fun of him.
zh: 我忍不住想取笑他。

en: You should not make fun of him.
zh: 你不该拿他开涮。

en: It is impudent of you to jest at him.
zh: 你这样嘲笑他也太没礼貌了。

en: If you flatter him, he'll do anything.
zh: 你要是拍他马屁，他什么都肯干。

en: You may call him a liar, but you cannot call him a bad man.
zh: 你可以说他爱撒谎，但不能说他是坏人。

en: You ought not to treat him like that.
zh: 你不该那样对他。

en: Shall I have him go with you?
zh: 要不要我让他陪你一起去？

en: It seems a bit feudal to call him "sir".
zh: 叫他“大人”感觉有点封建。

en: They are very compatible.
zh: 他们俩挺合得来的。

en: They are mere creatures of habit.
zh: 他们只不过是习惯的奴隶。

en: Although they are twins, they have few interests in common.
zh: 虽然是双胞胎，但他们几乎没什么共同爱好。

en: Not all of them are present.
zh: 他们没全到。

en: They did not know it themselves.
zh: 他们自己都不知道。

en: They died one after another.
zh: 他们一个接一个地去世了。

en: They look down on us as inexperienced young men.
zh: 他们瞧不起我们这些没经验的小伙子。

en: They all tried to talk at one time.
zh: 他们都抢着说话。

en: They love each other.
zh: 他们很爱对方。

en: Don't you like them any at all?
zh: 你一点都不喜欢他们吗？

en: Do you really not like them?
zh: 你真的不喜欢他们吗？

en: Let them come in.
zh: 让他们进来吧。

en: It is absurd to try to persuade them.
zh: 劝他们简直是白费口舌。

en: Can you put them on the witness stand?
zh: 你能让他们出庭作证吗？

en: Will you help them?
zh: 你会帮他们吗？

en: Are you planning to help them?
zh: 你打算帮他们吗？

en: Are you thinking of helping them?
zh: 你在考虑帮他们吗？

en: There's no need to see them off.
zh: 没必要去送他们。

en: They had to be turned away from the theater.
zh: 他们被剧院拒之门外了。

en: He gave me authority to fire them.
zh: 他授权我可以开除他们。

en: It is our duty to help them.
zh: 帮助他们是我们的义务。

en: We practiced very hard to beat them.
zh: 为了赢他们，我们练得很辛苦。

en: In order to beat them, we practice very hard.
zh: 为了打败他们，我们练得非常刻苦。

en: Don't make fun of them.
zh: 别拿他们开玩笑。

en: Do you mind their coming too?
zh: 你介意他们也来吗？

en: Are they coming as well?
zh: 他们也来吗？

en: They may yet be happy.
zh: 他们以后还是会幸福的。

en: They'll give in to us some day.
zh: 总有一天他们会向我们低头的。

en: They are still seeking evidence.
zh: 他们还在找证据。

en: I bought them each a present.
zh: 我给他们每人买了一份礼物。

en: They're eating high on the hog.
zh: 他们现在吃香的喝辣的。

en: They were walking along the street arm in arm.
zh: 他们手挽手在街上走着。

en: They walked along the avenue, arm in arm.
zh: 他们手挽着手走在大街上。

en: They came walking arm in arm.
zh: 他们手挽着手走过来了。

en: They bribed the witness into silence.
zh: 他们收买证人让他闭嘴。

en: They stopped talking.
zh: 他们不说话了。

en: They are not of above taking bribes.
zh: 他们也不是不收贿赂的人。

en: They were cut off in the middle of their telephone conversation.
zh: 他们的电话打到一半断了。

en: They stopped to talk.
zh: 他们停下来聊天。

en: They can think and speak.
zh: 他们能思考，也会说话。

en: They sued for peace.
zh: 他们求和了。

en: They failed to take into account the special needs of old people.
zh: 他们没考虑到老年人的特殊需求。

en: They will organize a labor union.
zh: 他们要组建工会。

en: They guaranteed regular employment to their workers.
zh: 他们向工人保证了稳定的工作。

en: They are demanding shorter working hours.
zh: 他们要求缩短工作时间。

en: They stood on the balcony to watch the festival in the street below.
zh: 他们站在阳台上看街上的庆典。

en: They scrambled for the penny in the street.
zh: 他们在街上抢着捡硬币。

en: They have lost 10 games in a row since their winning streak ended.
zh: 自从连胜终结后，他们已经连输十场了。

en: They got into the train.
zh: 他们上了火车。

en: They waited in line for the bus.
zh: 他们排队等公交车。

en: They believe that the soul is immortal.
zh: 他们相信灵魂是不朽的。

en: They attended worship.
zh: 他们去参加了礼拜。

en: They lugged the refrigerator up the stairs.
zh: 他们费力地把冰箱搬上了楼。

en: They are planning to extend the railroad to the next town.
zh: 他们打算把铁路延伸到下一个镇子。

en: They are on good terms with their neighbors.
zh: 他们跟邻居处得挺好的。

en: They're on good terms with their neighbors.
zh: 他们跟邻居关系挺不错。

en: They are the people who live next door.
zh: 他们就是住在隔壁的人。

en: They combined forces to fight the enemy.
zh: 他们联手对抗敌人。

en: They were delighted at the good news.
zh: 听到那个好消息，他们高兴坏了。

en: They were happy when they heard the good news.
zh: 听到好消息的时候，他们挺开心的。

en: They are nice boys and I am sure you will get on with them very well.
zh: 他们是很好的孩子，我相信你会跟他们相处得很好。

en: They didn't obey their parents.
zh: 他们不听父母的话。

en: They had plenty of money for the tour.
zh: 他们有足够的钱去旅行。

en: They approached the tourists and asked them for money.
zh: 他们走近游客并向他们要钱。

en: They are preparing for their trip.
zh: 他们正在准备旅行。

en: They were excited over their travel plans.
zh: 他们对旅行计划感到很兴奋。

en: They are making preparations for the trip.
zh: 他们正在为旅行做准备。

en: They were companions on the journey.
zh: 他们是旅途中的伙伴。

en: He had a great fancy for traveling.
zh: 他特别向往去旅行。

en: They are picked soldiers.
zh: 他们是精挑细选出来的士兵。

en: They are susceptible to changes in fashion.
zh: 他们很容易受流行趋势的影响。

en: They drifted down the river.
zh: 他们顺着河漂了下去。

en: They swam against the stream.
zh: 他们逆流而泳。

en: They bundled off in anger.
zh: 他们气呼呼地走了。

en: They feared being overheard.
zh: 他们怕被人听到。

en: They were afraid of being overheard.
zh: 他们担心会被别人偷听到。

en: They had no choice but to leave.
zh: 除了离开，他们别无选择。

en: They are maneuvering behind the scene.
zh: 他们在幕后操纵。

en: They allotted the profits fairly.
zh: 他们公平地分配了利润。

en: They were on the lookout for a storm.
zh: 他们在警惕着风暴的到来。

en: They went on putting aside fallen stones.
zh: 他们继续搬开掉下来的石头。

en: They faced the peril of falling rocks.
zh: 他们面临着落石的危险。

en: They believe in a life after death.
zh: 他们相信人死后有来世。

en: They will put the project into operation next spring.
zh: 他们明年春天会启动这个项目。

en: They're going to have a party next week.
zh: 他们下周要办个派对。

en: They will arrive a week from today.

en: They regarded him as a great scholar.

en: They chose him for their leader.

en: They looked on him as their leader.

en: They look up to him as their leader.

en: They made him captain of the team.
zh: 他们让他当了队长。

en: They consider him unfit for that job.
zh: 他们觉得他不适合那份工作。

en: They were very saddened to hear of his death.

en: They congratulated him on his marriage.

en: They regarded his behavior as childish.

en: They regarded him as a good scholar.

en: They laughed at the affectations in his speech.

en: They made him sign the contract.

en: They accorded him many honors.

en: They saw him enter the room.

en: They caught him stealing.

en: They thought he was the son of the Sun.

en: They could not tell whether he was dead or alive.

en: They assisted him in performing the operation.

en: They insist that he should go.

en: They concluded that he had told a lie.

en: They go to church on Sunday.

en: They settled in Japan.

en: They would never meet again.

en: They were speaking in a Southern dialect.

en: They explored the Antarctic.

zh: 他们到了南罗德西亚，当时有的选：要么住泥屋搭成的、公用自来水的移民营，要么住旅馆；因为他们挺有钱的，所以选了旅馆。

en: They entered into a discussion.

en: They found the stolen money.

en: They obtained a yield of 8 percent on their investment.

en: They called down the wrath of God upon the heads of their enemies.

en: They overcame the enemy.

en: They fought against the enemy.

en: They are not enemies, but friends.

en: They are pursuing the robber.

en: They are out in the garden.

en: They negotiate with their employer about their wages.

en: They broke the silence.

en: They came presently to our rescue.

en: They have lived here for a long time.

en: They stood talking for a long time.

en: They had to strive against natural calamities for ages.

en: They walked around the corner.

en: They will contribute greatly to the growth of the town.

en: They are amid the city noises.

en: They made their way toward the town.

en: They advanced on the town.

en: They are at lunch.

en: They studied the map to find a short cut.
zh: 他们研究地图想找条近路。

en: They loaded the trucks with emergency supplies for the earthquake victims.
zh: 他们把给地震灾民的应急物资装上了卡车。

en: They fled the town after the earthquake.
zh: 地震后他们逃离了那个小镇。

en: They know the importance of protecting the earth.
zh: 他们知道保护地球的重要性。

en: They argued that the earth is round.
zh: 他们争论说地球是圆的。

en: They believed that the earth was flat.
zh: 他们曾认为地球是平的。

en: They took the subway.
zh: 他们坐了地铁。

en: They went by subway.
zh: 他们是乘地铁去的。

en: They pretended ignorance.
zh: 他们假装不知道。

en: The news made them happy.
zh: 那个消息让他们很高兴。

en: They agreed on a price.
zh: 他们谈妥了价格。

en: They take it for granted that men and women are equal.
zh: 他们认为男女平等是理所当然的。

en: They chased the man to arrest him.
zh: 他们追赶那个人想把他抓起来。

en: They gathered about the fireplace.
zh: 他们聚在壁炉旁。

en: They got a warm reception.
zh: 他们受到了热烈欢迎。

en: They wear their hair bobbed.
zh: 他们留着齐耳短发。

en: They participated in the team games.
zh: 他们参加了团队游戏。

en: None of them are happy.
zh: 他们谁都不开心。

en: Who are they?
zh: 他们是谁？

en: They aren't hated by anybody.
zh: 没人讨厌他们。

en: They eat a lot of rice.
zh: 他们吃很多米饭。

en: They cashed in on the second oil crisis.
zh: 他们借着第二次石油危机大捞了一笔。
